data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3341040,"name":"Ben Goggans","username":"TARDIS_Boy_01","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-23T00:04:22.100Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThis is a last ditch effort to fix this bizarre occurrence mid-competition so, it’s sorta time sensitive. On teather, it works perfectly fine, but the moment that we engage teleop on the field through radio, the communication to the drivetrain is nonexistent with absolutely no other symptoms. Sometimes it reconnects like a minute into the match and is fine for the rest of it. We are stumped, all of the crescendo volunteers are stumped, and we have exhausted every solution we could think of, which is not much given that we can’t think of what could be causing this. It’s not a power issue, not a coding issue (we think), and not a wired connection issue. We don’t know what to do so, has anyone else experienced anything similar?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-23T00:04:22.100Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":63,"readers_count":62,"score":17.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459758,"topic_slug":"robot-mysteriously-not-communicating-with-excessively-the-wheels-while-on-radio-connection","display_username":"Ben Goggans","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63608,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I hope I can change this later."},"post_url":"/t/robot-mysteriously-not-communicating-with-excessively-the-wheels-while-on-radio-connection/459758/1","custom_user_title":"I hope I can change this later.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3341048,"name":"That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic","username":"Domm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domm/{size}/220499_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-23T00:22:22.259Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHave you tried re-imaging your RIO? I know this is time sensitive so I will keep this short- Basically from my experience when there is an issue on a robot at all (especially when everything works perfectly fine while tethered.) there is usually a wiring issue somewhere with the radio. If you are correct that there is no wiring issue in with your robot- try re-imaging your RIO. It sounds dumb but whenever we’ve had issues that have been otherwise unexplainable, re-imaging the RIO always has cleared it up. Usually in my experience if there is some sort of weird  issue that isn’t code or wiring but has some semblance of it the imaging on the RIO has been the issue. If you haven’t tried it already, I would give it a shot. Good luck to you at your comp!!!\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-23T00:22:22.259Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":11.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459758,"topic_slug":"robot-mysteriously-not-communicating-with-excessively-the-wheels-while-on-radio-connection","display_username":"That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56935,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 93 - Pit/Electrical Lead"},"post_url":"/t/robot-mysteriously-not-communicating-with-excessively-the-wheels-while-on-radio-connection/459758/2","custom_user_title":"Team 93 - Pit/Electrical Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341064,"name":"RogerR","username":"RogerR","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rogerr/{size}/605_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-23T00:51:24.189Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eTalking to some of your folks in the pit, I know it was mentioned that it only happens on the field, while connected to the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eFMS\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Field Management System\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e. The practice field here has one radio set up for wireless connection. In the morning, could you guys try and duplicate the problem using the practice radio, and/or the tether while on the practice field? It might isolate some potential factors (no \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eFMS\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Field Management System\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, no data throttling, different radio), and potentially help narrow your search.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-23T00:51:24.189Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":39,"readers_count":38,"score":17.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459758,"topic_slug":"robot-mysteriously-not-communicating-with-excessively-the-wheels-while-on-radio-connection","display_username":"RogerR","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2011,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-mysteriously-not-communicating-with-excessively-the-wheels-while-on-radio-connection/459758/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3565666,"name":"system","username":"system","avatar_template":"/uploads/default/original/4X/9/3/2/93234578e69f55873c63fc00fe2d0d85f23bce55.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T00:51:44.057Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThis topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply.
